alert.note: Alert for Benton; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 1:14AM CDT until June 18 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Benton County in northwestern Arkansas... Northwestern Washington County in northwestern Arkansas... Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Ottawa County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 215 AM CDT. * At 113 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles north of Pensacola to 4 miles northeast of Leach to 5 miles north of Tahlequah, moving northeast at 65 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS! HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. * Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Siloam Springs... Jay... Bella Vista... Lowell... Grove... Pea Ridge... Gentry... Tontitown... Gravette... Cave Springs... Decatur... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Highfill... Gateway... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 64 and 93. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: These are potentially deadly storms. Seek shelter in an interior room on the lowest floor of a well-built structure. Abandon vehicles in search of a more substantial permanent structure. Stay away from windows.
